    public abstract class Project
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

      java.lang.String toString()
      This method return the title of the project to be printed
      void unvote()
      By general the user cannot unvote, but if he gets ban the project must loose one vote, all this is managed by the system, we just have implement this method, to make the program more handable.
      void unvoteProject​(Group group, User user)
      This method handled the possible situation when an user leaves a group, and that groups were supporting this project, so this subroutine will decrement by one the number of votes of the project only if the user is not supporting the project individually (or by belonging to other group that also supports the project) too.
      void update​(Group g)
      This method checks whether the information of group g is up to date, depending if we want to add or remove information from project we need to specified it with its parameters
      void update​(User u)
      This method checks whether the information of group g is up to date, depending if we want to add or remove information from project we need to specified it with its parameters
      void vote()
      This function does not syschronize nothing, it is not a well practice to use it, but sometimes is necessary
      boolean voteGroup​(Group voter)
      This method evaluates whether a given group vote for the instance of the project or not, if it can support the project, then the project will increment by the number of members of the group, their number of votes.
      boolean voteUser​(User voter)
      This method evaluates whether a given user can vote for the instance of the project or not, if he can support it, then the project will increment by one their number of votes.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Project

        public Project​(java.lang.String title,
               java.lang.String proponent,
               java.lang.String description,
               double moneyRequested)
        This is the constructor method
        Parameters:
        title - the title of the project
        proponent - the nickname of the user who has created the project
        description - the description of the project with a maximum of 500 characters
        moneyRequested - the money that the proponent is asking for to accomplish the project

      • askForMoneyGranted

        public void askForMoneyGranted()
                        throws es.uam.eps.sadp.grants.InvalidRequestException,
                               java.io.IOException,
                               es.uam.eps.sadp.grants.InvalidIDException
        This method sets the external money given for a project
        Throws:
        es.uam.eps.sadp.grants.InvalidRequestException - if GrantRequest is not correct
        java.io.IOException - if there are communication problems
        es.uam.eps.sadp.grants.InvalidIDException - if id is not correct

      • voteUser

        public boolean voteUser​(User voter)
        This method evaluates whether a given user can vote for the instance of the project or not, if he can support it, then the project will increment by one their number of votes.
        Parameters:
        voter - is the user that wants to vote for the project.
        Returns:
        true if the vote could be processed, false if the user has already voted

      • voteGroup

        public boolean voteGroup​(Group voter)
        This method evaluates whether a given group vote for the instance of the project or not, if it can support the project, then the project will increment by the number of members of the group, their number of votes.
        Parameters:
        voter - is the group that wants to vote for the project.
        Returns:
        true if the vote could be processed, false if the group has already voted

      • isExpired

        public boolean isExpired()
        This method evaluates whether the time life of a project has been expired or not.
        Returns:
        true if the project is expired (if it runs out of time) or false otherwise.

      • getDaysLeft

        public long getDaysLeft()
        This method returns the days left that this project has to be voted
        Returns:
        days left that this project has to be voted, it is important to recall that if the return value is negative this project has already expired

      • checkNumberOfVotes

        public boolean checkNumberOfVotes()
        This method evaluates whether a given project has get the minimum number of votes that it needs to be send to the external association.
        Returns:
        true if the project is has get the minimum number of votes or false otherwise.

      • sendExternalAssociation

        public abstract void sendExternalAssociation()
                                      throws es.uam.eps.sadp.grants.InvalidRequestException,
                                             java.io.IOException
        This method send a project to the cityCouncil in order to validate it
        Throws:
        es.uam.eps.sadp.grants.InvalidRequestException - if GrantRequest is not correct
        java.io.IOException - if there are communication problems

      • deleteProject

        public void deleteProject()
        This method manages all the synchronization needed in order to remove a project from the system.

      • checkVotes

        protected boolean checkVotes​(User voter)
        This method evaluates whether a given user, is already supporting a project by belonging to any groups that support it or not.
        Parameters:
        voter - is the user to be check
        Returns:
        true if the voter is in any group that supports the project or false otherwise.

      • checkVotes

        protected boolean checkVotes​(User voter,
                             Group group)
        This method evaluates whether a given user, is already supporting a project by belonging to any groups that support it or not.
        Parameters:
        voter - is the user to be check
        group - the group you want to exclude
        Returns:
        true if the voter is in any group that supports the project or false otherwise.

      • unvoteProject

        public void unvoteProject​(Group group,
                          User user)
        This method handled the possible situation when an user leaves a group, and that groups were supporting this project, so this subroutine will decrement by one the number of votes of the project only if the user is not supporting the project individually (or by belonging to other group that also supports the project) too.
        Parameters:
        group - is the group which the user leaves
        user - is the user who leaves the group

      • unvote

        public void unvote()
        By general the user cannot unvote, but if he gets ban the project must loose one vote, all this is managed by the system, we just have implement this method, to make the program more handable.

      • vote

        public void vote()
        This function does not syschronize nothing, it is not a well practice to use it, but sometimes is necessary

      • update

        public void update​(User u)
        This method checks whether the information of group g is up to date, depending if we want to add or remove information from project we need to specified it with its parameters
        Parameters:
        u - , the user to be checked

      • update

        public void update​(Group g)
        This method checks whether the information of group g is up to date, depending if we want to add or remove information from project we need to specified it with its parameters
        Parameters:
        g - , the group to be checked
